channel.title: WTF is with Steam?
channel.description:
This has been going on for a while now. It's happened since Steam updated itself to the sleek matte-black UI instead of the blocky green interface. This creates a new problem; I've never even seen the games menu, because the whole program immediately freezes when it checks for updates. I'm unable to do jack shit since steam is basically my whole gaming axis and steam won't do jack shit.
I have Windows Vista, if that helps

item.title: WTF is with Steam?
item.dc:creator: ManlyStump
item.description:
Hanzales:

Totally agree. I’m using Windows from 3.1 version. And Vista (together with Milenium Edition) are the worst OS released by MS. First half year was a disaster. I just absolutely skipped Vista (with DX10 card) and don’t regret anything.

W7 worked good and smoothly even as RC. I am just surprised myself

Even now when I have to do anything with Vista I’m nervous but maybe it is only psychical ;O)

I hate Vista as much as anybody, but I’m not so sure about the worst. After all my old computer came preloaded with Windows ME :fffuuu:

EDIT: How did I not notice that?

Read full topic

item.title: WTF is with Steam?
item.dc:creator: tscolin
item.description:
Pokemon Eater:

This has been going on for a while now. It’s happened since Steam updated itself to the sleek matte-black UI instead of the blocky green interface. This creates a new problem; I’ve never even seen the games menu, because the whole program immediately freezes when it checks for updates. I’m unable to do jack shit since steam is basically my whole gaming axis and steam won’t do jack shit.

I have Windows Vista, if that helps

Windows vista is a problem, unrelated. Close steam, go to the steam base directory (ex: c:\Program Files\Steam), and delete clientregistry.blob and re-open steam. Should be fixed!

Read full topic

item.title: WTF is with Steam?
item.dc:creator: signati
item.description:
av3nger:

I find Windows 7 to actually not manage memory better, but worse…when I had vista I had 3 gigs of memory…and it said 27% physical memory…well I have windows 7 64 bit home premium and guess what, I have 4 gigs of memory and my physical memory is about the same…it’s usually like in the 30’s and if I’m unlucky the high 40’s/50

The memory usage is due to superfetch, probably being configured differently between the two operating systems. Superfetch just caches commonly used applications so that they open quicker.
The majority of that used memory is likely to be your cached apps.
I personally don’t know how much memory the OS uses for the stack/kernel in vista/7 though and unless that’s known then there isn’t much point in comparing their respective memory usage.

Read full topic

W7 worked good and smoothly even as RC. I am just surprised myself

Even now when I have to do anything with Vista I’m nervous but maybe it is only psychical ;O)

item.description:
Well, it definitely got a bad rap when it was first released. After all of the updates and fixes, I didn’t think it was really that bad. But now that I’ve gone Windows 7, I can never go back.

item.title: WTF is with Steam?
item.dc:creator: p0rt1r
item.description:
try this, run msconfig and only run the bare essentials
(google the app’s 1 by 1 if you have to). try running steam now, if it dont work try updating steam…

ccleaner wont do shit, when i first used that new UI i was running win7 32bit and the computer completely shat itself whenever steam opened, it would take like an hour to open the games section… i formatted and used win7 64bit ult + 4gb ram, now it works fine for me.

windows 7 is bloody good if you own a good computer. It does eat abit more ram but it uses it better i hear. Its also got dx11 support so eh. Once you get used to the UI its a whole lot cleaner to use than xp.

[specs: c2q q9650 @3ghz, msi cyclone r4890 soc, 4gb ram]

Read full topic

item.title: WTF is with Steam?
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
m4rek:

Upgrade to Windows XP

QFT

Pokemon Eater:

How the hell is Malwarebytes supposed to help? I’ve made sure I have now viruses.

Won’t I have to format my hard drive if I upgrade to Win 7?

jethrosoup:

You could always do the upgrade, which will preserve some files, but I’d rather do a clean install.

just a bit of info: a clean install of windows doesn’t force you to format, the XP installer just deletes Vista’s Windows folder and 7 moves Windows, Program Files and Users into C:\Windows.old

Read full topic

item.title: WTF is with Steam?
item.dc:creator: canasia_us
item.description:
Pokemon Eater:

How the hell is Malwarebytes supposed to help? I’ve made sure I have now viruses.

Won’t I have to format my hard drive if I upgrade to Win 7?

Always a good idea to reformat the hard drive when you install any version of Windows. Gets rid of all the garbage files that might be screwing up your system.

Read full topic
